description: Used to point to additional property files to load. All properties must be unique and are ultimately pooled into a single unordered set.
Auto-load all files matching conf/**/*.properties
The unique name of the IdP used as the iisuer in all SAML profiles
Identifies the file to serve for requests to the IdP's well-known metadata location
Whether to allow use of the SAML artifact bindings when sending messages
Whether preparation of messages to be communicated via SAML artifact should assume use of a secure channel (allowing signing and encryption to be skipped)
Identifies the <ArtifactResolutionService> endpoint in SAML metadata associated with artifacts issued by a server node
Storage back-end to use for short-lived SAML Artifact mappings (must be server-side)

Controls whether the outbound binding selection is ordered by the SP's metadata or the IdP's preferred bindings (the inbuilt default order is Redirect -> POST -> Artifact -> SOAP). Set to false to leave artifact support on, but favor use of POST. Set also to false to favor the front channel over back channel for Logout.
Identifies the file to serve for requests to the IdP's well-known metadata location
applies a (fixed) scope typically a domain-valued suffix to an input attribute's values
If true all cookies issued by the IdP (not including the container) will be limited to TLS
If true all cookies issued by the IdP (not including the container) will contain the HttpOnly property
Overrides the domain of any cookies issued by the IdP (not including the container)
Overrides the path of any cookies issued by the IdP (not including the container)
Lifetime in seconds of cookies issued by the IdP that are meant to span sessions (365 days)
Default SameSite value to apply to cookies via servlet filter if no explicit rule for the named cookie is specified
Predicate<ServletRequest> condition bean controlling whether SameSite filter runs
Bean ID supporting the DataSealerKeyStrategy interface to use in place of the built-in option.
Type of Java keystore used for IdP's internal AES encryption key
Time between checks for a new AES key version
Case insensitive name of keystore alias prefix used in AES keystore (the entries will be suffixed by the key version number)
Keystore resource containing AES encryption key usually a file path
Resource that tracks the active AES encryption key version usually a file path
Keystore password unlocking AES encryption keystore typically set during installation
Key password unlocking AES encryption key typically set to the same as the previous property and set during installation
Resource containing private key for signing typically a file in the credentials directory
Resource containing the public key certificate inserted into signed messages typically a file in the credentials directory
Resource containing a private key for decryption typically a file in the credentials directory
Resource containing a public key certificate given to others needing to encrypt data for the IdP typically a file in the credentials directory
Resource containing an alternate private key for decryption generally unused except while changing decryption keys
Resource containing an alternate public key certificate generally unused except while changing decryption keys
Name of Spring bean supplying the default SecurityConfiguration
Name of Spring bean supplying the default SignatureSigningConfiguration
Name of Spring bean supplying the default EncryptionConfiguration
If true failure to locate an encryption key to use won't result in request failure
Sets the default strategy for key agreement key wrap usage for credentials from metadata if not otherwise configured on the security configuration
Name of Spring bean for the trust engine used to verify signatures
Name of Spring bean for the trust engine used to verify TLS certificates
Default freshness window for accepting timestamped messages
Default freshness window for accepting timestamped assertions
Default allowance for clock differences between systems
Overrides the BasicKeyInfoGeneratorFactory used by default
Overrides the X509KeyInfoGeneratorFactory used by default
Enables CSRF protection
Name of the HTTP parameter that stores the CSRF token
Auto-configures an HSTS response header
Auto-configures an X-Frame-Options response header
Auto-configures a Content Security Policy response header
Location from which to load user-supplied webflows from

Location from which to load user-modifiable Velocity view templates. This can be set to include "classpath*:/META-INF/net/shibboleth/idp/views" (or equivalent) to load templates from the classpath, such as from extension jars, but doing so disables support for template reloading.
Whether to expose detailed error causes in status information provided to outside parties
Whether to digitally sign error responses in SAML or similar protocols, if signing is otherwise warranted (this can prevent a simple denial of service vector, since errors are simple to trigger)
The default view name to render for exceptions and events

Bean defing Properties mapping exception class names to error views. The matching by class name does not support wildcards, but does do substring matches (so it's not necessary to fully qualify the class).
Bean defining Collection<Class> identifying exception classes to ignore (causing them to bubble outward, so use with caution)
Interval of background thread sweeping server-side storage for expired records
Whether to use HTML Local Storage (if available) instead of cookies
Name of cookie or HTML storage key used by the default per-session instance of the client storage service
Name of cookie or HTML storage key used by the default persistent instance of the client storage service
Storage back-end to use for message replay checking (must be server-side)
Whether storage errors during replay checks should be treated as a replay
Whether to enable the IdP's session tracking feature
Bean name of a storage implementation/configuration to use for IdP sessions
Name of cookie containing IdP session ID (note this is not the same as the cookie the Java container uses to track its own sessions)
Number of characters in IdP session identifiers
Whether to bind IdP sessions to IP addresses
A 2-argument predicate that compares a bound session's address to a client address
Inactivity timeout policy for IdP sessions (must be non-zero)
Extra time after expiration before removing SP sessions in case a logout is invoked
Whether to hide storage failures from users during session cache reads/writes
Whether to save a record of every SP accessed during an IdP session (requires a server-side session store or HTML LocalStorage)
Whether to track SPs on the basis of the SAML subject ID used, for logout purposes (requires SP session tracking be on)
Default length of time to maintain record of an SP session (must be non-zero), overridable by relying-party-specific setting
Required expression that identifies the login flows to globally enable
Default amount of time to allow reuse prior authentication flows
Default inactivity timeout to prevent reuse of prior authentication flows
Whether to enforce restrictions placed on further proxying of assertions from upstream IdPs when relying on proxied authentication
Whether to prioritize prior authentication results when an SP requests more than one possible matching method
Whether to populate information about the relying party into the tree for user interfaces during login and interceptors
Whether to fail requests if a user identity after authentication doesn't match the identity in a pre-existing session.
Provides a static discovery URL to use for external discovery this property replaces the need for the XML-defined bean used in V4.0 for this purpose

Whether to override an explicit <RequestedAuthnContext> element in an SP’s request with a configuration-imposed rule via the defaultAuthenticationMethods profile configuration setting. Note this is a violation of the SAML standard and is also a global setting applying to all SPs that may have such a profile configuration set.
Name of storage service used to store users' consent choices
Name of function used to return the String storage key representing a user defaults to the principal name
Attribute whose value is the storage key representing a user
Optional condition to apply to control activation of attribute-release flow along with system default behavior
Default consent auditing formats
Name of function used to return the String storage key representing a user defaults to the principal name
Attribute whose value is the storage key representing a user
Suffix of message property used as value of consent storage records when idp.consent.compareValues is true
Optional condition to apply to control activation of terms-of-use flow
Default consent auditing formats
Whether not remembering/storing consent is allowed
Whether consent to any attribute and to any relying party is allowed
Whether per-attribute consent is allowed
Whether attribute values and terms of use text are stored and compared for equality
Maximum number of records stored when using space-limited storage (e.g. cookies), 0 = no limit
Maximum number of records stored when using larger/server-side storage, 0 = no limit
Time in milliseconds to expire consent storage records
Whether to search metadata for user interface information associated with every service involved in logout propagation
Whether to require signed logout messages in accordance with the SAML 2.0 standard
If the bean returns true the user is given the option to actually cancel the IdP logout outright and prevent removal of the session
Processes arbitrary query parameters to the Simple Logout endpoint and stashes them in a ScratchContext for use by subsequent view logic
When true allows inbound SAML LogoutRequests to be processed even if the SP lacks metadata containing response endpoints
Applies the "display:none" style to the list of SPs and logout status reporting images so that logout status is not visibly reported to the user

property_type: Bean ID of HttpClient to use for SOAP-based logout
description: Allows the HttpClient used for SOAP communication to be overriden (applies to SAML logout via SOAP)
languages to use if no match can be found with the browser-supported languages
Storage service used by CAS protocol for chained proxy-granting tickets and when using server-managed "simple" TicketService. MUST be server-side storage (e.g. in-memory, memcached, database)
CAS service registry implementation class
If true CAS services provisioned with SAML metadata are identified via entityID
Enables F-TICKS output and specifies the value of the federation-identifier field
Optional bean name of a Predicate<ProfileRequestContext> to use to decide whether to run
Digest algorithm used to obscure usernames
A salt to apply when digesting usernames (if not specified, the username will not be included)
The remote syslog host
The remote syslog port
Set false if you want SAML bindings "spelled out" in audit log
Set to true to fail on velocity syntax errors
Path to use with External interceptor flow
Policies to use with Impersonate interceptor flow
Policies to use with Impersonate interceptor flow
Controls the workflow for how authentication occurs against LDAP: one of anonSearchAuthenticator, bindSearchAuthenticator, directAuthenticator, adAuthenticator
Connection URI for LDAP directory
Whether StartTLS should be used after connecting with LDAP alone.
Time to wait for the TCP connection to occur.
Time to wait for an LDAP response message
Connection strategy to use when multiple URLs are supplied: one of ACTIVE_PASSIVE, ROUND_ROBIN, RANDOM
How to establish trust in the server's TLS certificate: one of jvmTrust, certificateTrust, or keyStoreTrust
A resource to load trust anchors from when using sslConfig = certificateTrust
A resource to load a Java keystore containing trust anchors when using sslConfig = keyStoreTrust
List of attributes to request during authentication
Base DN to search against when using an LDAP.authenticator of anonSearchAuthenticator or bindSearchAuthenticator
Whether to search recursively when using an LDAP.authenticator of anonSearchAuthenticator or bindSearchAuthenticator
LDAP search filter when using an LDAP.authenticator of anonSearchAuthenticator or bindSearchAuthenticator
DN to bind with during search when using an LDAP.authenticator = bindSearchAuthenticator
Password to bind with during search when using an LDAP.authenticator = bindSearchAuthenticator usually set via %{idp.home}/credentials/secrets.properties
A formatting string to generate the user DNs to authenticate when using an LDAP.authenticator of directAuthenticator or adAuthenticator
Whether the user's LDAP entry should be returned in the authentication response even when the user bind fails.
Whether the user's LDAP entry should be resolved with the bindDN credentials rather than as the authenticated user.
Whether to use the Password Policy Control.
Whether to use the Password Expired Control.

If you are using Active Directory this switch will attempt to use the account states defined by AD. Note that this flag is unnecessary if you are using the 'adAuthenticator'. It is meant to be specified with one of the other authenticator types.
If you are using the FreeIPA LDAP this switch will attempt to use the account states defined by that product.
If you are using the EDirectory LDAP this switch will attempt to use the account states defined by that product.
Whether connection pools should be used for LDAP authentication and DN resolution
Minimum LDAP connection pool size
Maximum LDAP connection pool size
Whether to validate connections when checking them out of the pool
Whether to validate connections in the background
Duration between validation if idp.pool.LDAP.validatePeriodically is true
DN to search with the validateFilter: defaults to the rootDSE
Search filter to execute in order to validate a pooled connection
Duration between looking for idle connections to reduce the pool back to its minimum size
Duration connections must be idle to be eligible for pruning
Duration to wait for a free connection in the pool

Controls how connections in the bind pool are passivated. Connections in the bind pool may be in an authenticated state that will not allow validation searches to succeed. This property controls how bind connections are placed back into the pool. If your directory requires searches to be performed by the idp.authn.LDAP.bindDN or anonymously, this property controls that behavior. one of: none, bind, anonymousBind.
Comma-delimited set of JAAS application configuration names to use
Location of JAAS configuration file
Whether to reload the underlying Kerberos configuration (generally in /etc/krb5.conf) on every login attempt
Whether to preserve the resulting Kerberos TGT in the Java Subject's private credential set
Name of a service principal to use to verify the KDC supplying the TGT by requesting and verifying a service ticket issued for it
Path to a keytab file containing keys belonging to the service principal defined in idp.authn.Krb5.servicePrincipal

Whether attribute resolution failure should silently produce no attributes or cause an overall profile request failure event

Whether null values should be stripped from the results of the attribute resolution. This filtering happens prior to filtering and encoding, but after attribute resolution is complete. To strip nulls during attribute resolution (so that they will be invisible to dependant attribute definitions) use a SimpleAttributeDefinition and specify ignoreNullValues

Setting this to false re-enables the legacy behavior of looking up the display information for the resolved attributes during resolution. As from 4.2 this the display information is looked up at point of use (during the attribute consent flow) and so there should be no reason to revert this behavior unless using third party software which expect the IdPAttribute DisplayName and DisplayDescriptions to be pre-populated

Supplies the DNS name used within the URLs specifying the end points. This should not be used in conjunction with the --DNSName qualifier
Specifies the path to the certificate protecting the back channel. This should not be used in conjunction with the --backChannel qualifier.

Specifies the path part of the URL which describes a logo for the IdP. The protocol is hard wired to be https://  and the DNS name is used for the host. The <mdui:Logo> is always  emitted.  If this is absent then then a fixed path ('/path/to/logo') is used.
The height of the logo in pixels.
The width of the logo in pixels

A space separated list of languages used to lookup values formed appending each one to the name and description properties idp.metadata.idpsso.mdui.displayname.<lang> and idp.metadata.idpsso.mdui.description.<lang>. If this is absent then an <mdui:DisplayName/> and <mdui:Description> for the "en" language is emitted which you need to edit.
Display name for the IdP in the specified language. If this is absent for a language specified above then not <mdui:DisplayName> is emitted for that language
Description for the IdP in the specified language. If this is absent for a language specified above then not <mdui:Description> is emitted for that language
Set false to preclude issuing unencrypted ID/UserInfo tokens without specific overrides
The validity of client secret registered
Regardless of what signing algorithms are configured allow none for request object signing

Bean used for extracting login_hint from the authentication request. The default function parses login_hint as is.
